machine learning: Machine learning enables systems to learn patterns from data and make predictions.
supervised learning: Supervised learning uses labeled data to train models.
unsupervised learning: Unsupervised learning finds hidden patterns in unlabeled datasets.
decision tree: Decision trees split data based on feature conditions.
random forest: Random Forest combines multiple decision trees for better accuracy.
gradient boosting: Gradient boosting builds models sequentially to reduce errors.
xgboost: XGBoost is an optimized gradient boosting algorithm.
lightgbm: LightGBM is a fast gradient boosting framework.
bias variance tradeoff: It balances model complexity and generalization.
overfitting: Overfitting occurs when a model learns noise instead of patterns.
underfitting: Underfitting happens when a model is too simple.
mean: Mean is the average value of numbers.
median: Median is the middle value in a sorted dataset.
mode: Mode is the most frequent value.
standard deviation: Standard deviation shows how far values deviate from the mean.
central limit theorem: Sample means approach normal distribution as sample size increases.
p value: Probability of observing results assuming null hypothesis is true.
confidence interval: Range of values likely to contain the true parameter.
bayes theorem: Updates probability based on prior knowledge.
numpy: NumPy provides numerical operations on arrays.
pandas: Pandas provides DataFrame structures for analysis.
scikit learn: Scikit-learn is a machine learning library.
eda: Exploratory Data Analysis helps understand datasets.
missing values: Null or empty values in datasets.
outliers: Extreme values that differ from others.
inner join: Returns matching records from both tables.
left join: Returns all records from left table.
star schema: Data warehouse schema with fact and dimension tables.
neural network: Model inspired by human brain structure.
sigmoid: Activation function mapping values between 0 and 1.
lemmatization: Converting words to base dictionary form.
tf idf: Measures importance of words in documents.
k means clustering: Groups data into clusters based on similarity.
big data: Extremely large datasets requiring distributed processing.
concept drift: Change in relationship between input and output.
kendall correlation: Kendall correlation measures ordinal association between variables.
anova: ANOVA tests differences between group means.
chi square test: Chi-square test evaluates association between categorical variables.
t test: T-test compares means between two groups.
skewness: Skewness measures asymmetry of data distribution.
kurtosis: Kurtosis measures heaviness of distribution tails.
quantile: Quantiles divide data into equal-sized intervals.
percentile: Percentile indicates relative standing in dataset.
violin plot: Violin plot combines boxplot with distribution density.
pair plot: Pair plot shows relationships between multiple variables.
facet grid: FacetGrid creates multiple plots based on categories.
count plot: Count plot displays frequency of categorical data.
density plot: Density plot shows probability distribution of variables.
log scale: Log scale transforms axis to logarithmic values.
feature interaction: Feature interaction occurs when variables influence each other.
polynomial features: Polynomial features create nonlinear feature combinations.
residual: Residual is difference between actual and predicted value.
homoscedasticity: Homoscedasticity means constant variance of errors.
leverage: Leverage measures influence of data points in regression.
monte carlo simulation: Monte Carlo uses random sampling for simulations.
jackknife resampling: Jackknife evaluates model stability by removing observations.
bayesian inference: Bayesian inference updates probability using evidence.
markov chain: Markov chain models probabilistic transitions between states.
hidden markov model: HMM models sequential data with hidden states.
kalman filter: Kalman filter estimates system states over time.
prophet model: Prophet is a time series forecasting tool by Meta.
exponential smoothing: Exponential smoothing forecasts time series data.
moving average: Moving average smooths time series fluctuations.
stationarity: Stationary time series has constant statistical properties.
autocorrelation: Autocorrelation measures correlation with past values.
partial autocorrelation: PACF shows correlation excluding intermediate lags.
recommender system: Recommender systems suggest items to users.
implicit feedback: Implicit feedback uses indirect user signals.
explicit feedback: Explicit feedback uses ratings or reviews.
a b testing: A/B testing compares performance of two variants.
data governance: Data governance manages data quality and policies.
data lineage: Data lineage tracks data flow across systems.
data catalog: Data catalog organizes metadata for datasets.
schema evolution: Schema evolution handles structure changes in data.
slowly changing dimension: SCD tracks historical changes in warehouses.
partitioning: Partitioning splits data for faster querying.
bucketing: Bucketing groups rows into fixed buckets.
parquet: Parquet is a columnar storage format.
orc format: ORC is an optimized columnar data format.
avro: Avro is a row-based data serialization format.
kafka: Kafka is a distributed event streaming platform.
feature store: Feature store manages reusable ML features.
edge deployment: Edge deployment runs models on devices.
quantization: Quantization reduces model size for deployment.
pruning: Pruning removes unnecessary neural network weights.
knowledge distillation: Distillation transfers knowledge from large model to smaller one.
fine tuning: Fine tuning adjusts pretrained models to new tasks.
meta learning: Meta learning learns how to learn.
q learning: Q-learning learns optimal actions via value estimation.
deep q network: DQN combines deep learning with reinforcement learning.
exploration vs exploitation: Balances trying new actions vs known rewards.
vector database: Vector databases store embeddings for similarity search.
embedding search: Embedding search finds semantically similar text.
semantic search: Semantic search understands meaning beyond keywords.
rag: Retrieval augmented generation combines search with language models.
prompt engineering: Prompt engineering designs inputs for AI models.
hallucination: Hallucination occurs when models generate incorrect facts.
top k sampling: Top-k sampling selects top probable tokens.
top p sampling: Top-p sampling selects tokens based on probability mass.
